title: spack hangs on the installation of boost

labels.name: triage
labels.description: The issue needs to be prioritized

body:
Previously I could install boost in a few minutes, now it has taken well over a half an hour and is still running

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack install boost
```

### Error Message

There is no error that gets reported, but a gdb `py-bt` reports the following as the place that it is hanging:

```console
Traceback (most recent call first):
  File "/usr/lib/python3.8/copy.py", line 144, in deepcopy
    copier = _deepcopy_dispatch.get(cls)

  File "/usr/lib/python3.8/copy.py", line 428, in deepcopy
  File "/usr/lib/python3.8/copy.py", line 230, in _deepcopy_dict
    y[deepcopy(key, memo)] = deepcopy(value, memo)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.8/copy.py", line 146, in deepcopy
    y = copier(x, memo)

    state = deepcopy(state, memo)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.8/copy.py", line 428, in deepcopy
  File "/usr/lib/python3.8/copy.py", line 296, in _reconstruct
    value = deepcopy(value, memo)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.8/copy.py", line 428, in deepcopy

    dest[sk] = copy.deepcopy(sv)

  File "/tmp/spack/lib/spack/spack/config.py", line 584, in get_config

  File "/tmp/spack/lib/spack/spack/config.py", line 614, in get
    value = self.get_config(section, scope=scope)
  File "/tmp/spack/lib/spack/spack/config.py", line 789, in get
    return config.get(path, default, scope)
  File "/tmp/spack/lib/spack/spack/package_prefs.py", line 747, in get_package_permissions

    self._target(*self._args, **self._kwargs)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.8/multiprocessing/process.py", line 571, in _bootstrap
  File "/usr/lib/python3.8/multiprocessing/popen_fork.py", line 75, in _launch
    code = process_obj._bootstrap(parent_sentinel=child_r)
```
